channel.title: CWE-78 on ZAP
channel.description: Recent content in CWE-78 on ZAP

item.title: Remote Code Execution - Shell Shock
item.description: The server is running a version of the Bash shell that allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: Remote Code Execution - Shell Shock
item.description: The server is running a version of the Bash shell that allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: Remote Code Execution (React2Shell)
item.description: The server is running Next.js and vulnerable versions of React Server Components with Next.js which allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.

item.title: Remote OS Command Injection
item.description: Attack technique used for unauthorized execution of operating system commands. This attack is possible when an application accepts untrusted input to build operating system commands in an insecure manner involving improper data sanitization, and/or improper calling of external programs.

item.title: Remote OS Command Injection (Time Based)
item.description: Attack technique used for unauthorized execution of operating system commands. This attack is possible when an application accepts untrusted input to build operating system commands in an insecure manner involving improper data sanitization, and/or improper calling of external programs.

item.title: Spring4Shell
item.description: The application appears to be vulnerable to CVE-2022-22965 (otherwise known as Spring4Shell) - remote code execution (RCE) via data binding.
